articles.title: Coronavirus survivor, once bedridden, unable to walk, tells people to stop 'complaining' over extended stay-at-home order - WTVD-TV
articles.description: A COVID-19 survivor from Wisconsin is sharing her message for anyone complaining about the extension of that state's stay-at-home order.
articles.content: NEW BERLIN, Wis. -- A Wisconsin woman who nearly lost her ability to walk after suffering from COVID-19 is imploring people to stop complaining and follow social distancing orders.Just a few weeks ago, 35-year-old Leah Blomberg was bedridden as she fought off… [+1718 chars]

articles.title: Explore coronavirus maps made from Facebook, Google, Apple user data - Business Insider - Business Insider
articles.description: Apple, Google, and Facebook are collecting data on people's movement from smartphone apps and using it to show where people have reduced mobility.
articles.content:
Tech giants are joining the fight against coronavirus — and in the process, they're giving us a look under the hood at some of the user data they've been tracking all along.

articles.title: Insulin maker offering free 90-day supply to patients financially impacted by pandemic - WTHR
articles.description: A pharmaceutical company is offering a free 90-day supply of insulin to anyone who lost their medical benefits from the coronavirus outbreak.
articles.content:
PLAINSBORO CENTER, N.J. (TEGNA) One insulin maker is offering diabetic patients free insulin for 90 days if they no longer have health insurance coverage because they lost their jobs during the COVID-19 economic crisis.
Pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk an… [+1409 chars]

articles.title: 5-year-old daughter of first responders dies from COVID-19 complications - KTRK-TV
articles.description: This is heartbreaking. 💔 Skylar dreamed of becoming a pediatric dentist and loved to dress up as a princess.
articles.content:
DETROIT, Michigan -- A 5-year-old girl is now the first child in Michigan to die from COVID-19.Skylar Herbert was just five years old.

articles.title: ‘Another nail in an almost closed coffin’: Trump faces his next coronavirus test - POLITICO
articles.description: Trump’s advisers recognize his bumpy rollout of coronavirus testing represents a major vulnerability in an election year.
articles.content: Just over 4 million tests have been completed so far, for a population of roughly 330 million Americans, amid widespread reports of sick Americans being unable to get tested quickly increasing the odds of spreading the virus. Estimates vary widely even among … [+3879 chars]
